page.title: 15The May Day Festival
page.content: Ickwell is probably most famous for its May Day Festival.Its historical roots go back to Roman times. The dancing takes place today round the permanently erected Maypole on Ickwell Green. The pole is red and white and on the top is a copper crown which was added in 1191.On May Bank Holiday Monday the carnival takes place during which the May Queen is presented with a gold locket. All the money collected by the "Moggers"is donated to charity and all the children who take part usually get some sort of treat. All around the green are stalls selling sweets, antiques etc., and usually there are a lot of competitions. The procession of dancers starts in Northill (1/2 a mile away)with the"Queen of the May"on the first float.
